title_short: (28108) Alcobendas - 24 Calle Clz8 G17 María Teresa

No services.

title: (19135) Armuña de Tajuña - 5 Calle de la Ermita
title_short: (19135) Armuña de Tajuña - 5 Calle de la Ermita
description:
Central open area, next to the town and the bar. Quiet town and no problem, there are more places nearby to leave it too.
100 meters away in the park opposite tennis courts, a fountain with water and in summer a beach bar and public toilets!

name: Camping Osuna
title: (28042) Camping Osuna
description:
Nuevo Camping Osuna, next to El Capricho Park is the only campsite in the city of Madrid. Ideal for visiting the city, a 7-minute walk from the Madrid metro, with a direct line to Gran Via (25min). Open all year long. Emptying of black and gray water only for lodged clients. Bakery, minimarket, cafeteria, Wi-Fi room...etc.
Food trucks, music and a pleasant nightlife.

title: (28702) San Sebastián de los Reyes - 2D Avenida de Navarra
title_short: (28702) San Sebastián de los Reyes - 2D Avenida de Navarra
description: Parking next to field hockey field. a bit steep but fine for overnight.

title: (28821) Coslada - 5 Calle Alejandro Goicoechea
description: Public parking near the "El Humedal" park without services, ample parking, quiet, well lit and located in a quiet and safe area.

title: (28702) San Sebastián de los Reyes - 34 Avenida Severo Ochoa
title_short: (28702) San Sebastián de los Reyes - 34 Avenida Severo Ochoa
description: Ample parking with several leveled areas for large motorhomes. It is the parking lot of the Dehesa Boyal sports center, there are summer pools with slides and a winter spa pool with a giant slide. Ideal to spend half Parking is prohibited from 11:30 p.m. to 6:30 a.m.

title: (28042) Madrid - 112 Calle Vía Dublín
description: Online parking next to IFEMA, with a subway at 200m, is between the IFEMA pavilion and a golf course. Car and truck parking place.

title: (28042) Madrid - 51 Avenida de Logroño
description:
Common parking with an avenue next to it and a park, very useful to spend a night.
With a metro station 5 minutes walk away, perfect for visiting the center.

title: (28055) Madrid - Av. de las Fuerzas Armadas
title_short: (28055) Madrid - Av. de las Fuerzas Armadas
description: Parking very close to Ifema, perfect for the Mad Cool Festival (5 to 10 min walk from the entrance). A few trees create shade, and a large public park is a 2-minute walk away with very clean toilets open during the day (go to the second brown hut, the 1st is a technical room). There is something to walk around and games for children. Tap with drinking water. Despite the festival, we were only a few Vans and CCs on this huge parking lot, so all very well-off and spaced out. For light sleepers, bring earplugs for the return walk of festival-goers, but the road is closed to traffic so perfect for the night.

title: (28055) Madrid - 1 Avenida de Francisco Javier Sáenz de Oiza
title_short: (28055) Madrid - 1 Avenida de Francisco Javier Sáenz de Oiza
description: Very quiet public parking, gravel, without services. It is in front of a forest park for walking and very close to the airport.

address.street: 1 Avenida de Francisco Javier Sáenz de Oiza

title: (28042) Madrid - 2 Calle Prov Parque Valdebebas 5
description: Ground parking. It has about 20 seats. next to where Real Madrid train and Valdebebas park

description: In the streets around the lots very quiet. no problem to park the camper, come in the evening because during the day filled with cars of people who work in the city, metro 2 minutes to the city, direct line 5. Osuna campsite 500 meters away for water and drainage, already mentioned.

title: (28042) Madrid - 5 Glorieta Su Alteza Real Don Juan de Borbón
title_short: (28042) Madrid - 5 Glorieta Su Alteza Real Don Juan de Borbón

title: (28042) Madrid - 8 Calle Amberes

title_short: (28160) Talamanca de Jarama - 4 Avenida de Alcalá

title: (28022) Madrid - 177G Calle de Sofía
description: Very quiet neighborhood and 200 meters from the metro station, the road can be heard a little, but it's fine, I would go back.

title: (28022) Madrid - 47 Paseo de Ginebra
description: In this avenue you can stay, there is hardly any noise. Good shade trees. Ideal for seeing a show at the Civitas Metropolitano. There are sources to drink. 2 Mercadonas less than 10 min.

Location reserved for vehicles other than cars, several other locations along this walk

title_short: (28055) Madrid - 8 Avenida de las Fuerzas Armadas

description: Quiet parking in summer, holidays and weekends. Small forest and park.

title: (28523) Rivas-Vaciamadrid - 2T Calle Pamplona

Parking spaces are about average length. We could fit our 6 meter van in a space. Might struggle if you’re longer.

title_short: (28100) Alcobendas - 140 Calle del Marqués de la Valdavia

It is not recommended to spend the night, although it can solve a bad night. avoid on weekdays from 7 to 15, it is very full of cars. Gratuitous. large aldi supermarket and hiper-usera, next door. you can use their toilets without giving explanations. gas station, mc donald, bars, restaurants. and quiet nights, although you have to keep in mind that it is in the middle of a city. enjoy it

description: Quiet street in the neighborhood of Sanchinarro to park and spend the night. Light rail station nearby to get around and get to know Madrid

title_short: (28500) Arganda del Rey - 2 Poligono Vp. Norte Poligonos

title: (19210) Yunquera de Henares -

title_short: (28037) Madrid - 8B Calle Juan de Arespacochaga y Felipe

title: (28043) Madrid - 71 Calle de Silvano
description: Parking all kinds of vehicles ... day and night ... we slept only 1 night, since we were on our way to visit some friends ... but you can stay more nights. prohibited on Tuesdays that there is a market. The Ice Palace, shopping center, is 1 minute walk, full of cafeteria and restaurants (McDonald, the southern one, the 100 montaditos ...)

title: (28580) Ambite - 441 Camino de Valdemera
description: Quiet site next to the Tajuña river and at the end of a green lane.

title: (28027) Madrid - 55C Calle Miami
description: Very quiet and safe road to leave the motorhome and visit Madrid. It parks very well outside office hours. It is an area of ​​upscale family homes. Connected to a beautiful park "Quinta de los Molinos". Very famous for its almond trees in bloom at the beginning of spring. Flat and wide street for parking. Metro very close.

title: (28032) Madrid - 32 Calle Jardín de la Duquesa
title_short: (28032) Madrid - 32 Calle Jardín de la Duquesa
description: Quiet zone, the access is done by one of its zebra crossings

title: (28522) Rivas-Vaciamadrid - 12 Calle José Luis Sampedro
description:
Very quiet area, next to the usual parking area for neighboring motorhomes. Glued to the local police with surveillance cameras in the area.
the water fountain works in summer
Litter bins.
A restaurant next door and a cafeteria/teteria.
Buses next door and metro 5 min with large parking.
Large motorhomes enter, it is usually free, if it is full in the vicinity there is always room.

title: (28033) Madrid - 38 Calle Santa Adela
description: Very large parking. Metro 5 min walk. No parking problems, I have a motorhome and live in front. The only thing on Sundays you can not park by market. You can also park in front.

title_short: (28050) Madrid - 27 Calle de la Princesa de Éboli

title_short: (28521) Rivas-Vaciamadrid - 153 Avenida Campillo de San Isidro
description: Signposted area for motorhomes. Quiet

title: (28500) - 16D Diseminado Cm de Alcala
description: It's a fairground car park, great to spend a night on your trip with the motorhome or camper if you are very tired. It is a quiet area where you can go unnoticed.

title: (28050) Madrid - 45 Calle de María Tudor
description: On the outskirts of Madrid, you can park around the park and in the surrounding streets, with pharmacies, local shops and churrerías

title: (28050) Madrid - 2 Calle de Vicente Blasco Ibáñez
title_short: (28050) Madrid - 2 Calle de Vicente Blasco Ibáñez
description: Quiet street to spend the night. Slightly sloping and no service.

title: (28522) - 1A Lugar Parque Rivas
description: Discreet parking next to the FeuVert del Carrefour, it is not so busy, employees' cars usually park, the parking lights turn off at 23:23, bathrooms inside the carrefour. I have not been disturbed at any time. Well clean area. Wifi inside the carrefour.

title: (28521) Rivas-Vaciamadrid - 3V Lugar Parque Rivas
description: Asphalt and dirt parking without prohibition sign no height bar, trees for shade. Next to Carrefour and other stores. No services. Restrooms in the mall.

title: (28160) Talamanca de Jarama - Calle de la Libertad
title_short: (28160) Talamanca de Jarama - Calle de la Libertad
description: Puente Nuevo area, a quiet place, where you can appreciate the Jarama river, in its fullness. Recreational benches preset by covid 19

title: (19144) Moratilla de los Meleros - CM-2006
description: Place to fill water. It has no tap, natural source. Can be filled with hose or jugs. It takes a while but fine.

title: (28017) Madrid - 35 Calle Gandhi
description: Pretty asphalted esplanade near the Mercadona metro and bus lines

title: (28521) Rivas-Vaciamadrid - 10 Calle Thomas Edison
description: Decathlon parking very quiet. We were also parked during the day and everything was perfect.

title: (28031) Madrid - 19 Carretera Madrid a Rivas Jarama
title_short: (28031) Madrid - 19 Carretera Madrid a Rivas Jarama
description: It is a Repsol gas station. It closes early and has a good flow to refill water.

title: (28032) Madrid - 5 Avenida Comunidades
description: Quiet and secluded place, with a public toilet nearby.

title: (28050) Madrid - 11 Calle del Arroyo de Valdebebas
title_short: (28050) Madrid - 11 Calle del Arroyo de Valdebebas
description: Perfect place to sleep, a little noise from cars, but the truth is that very quiet, 50 meters from a bus stop, we were 3 days without problems of any kind, quite flat in some parking spaces.

title: (28750) San Agustín del Guadalix -
description: Great place, nice view, very peaceful. In the morning for walkers and mountain bikers. Difficult access by small paths (it goes by L2H2 van) Pretty waterfall (cascada del hervidero) above the village of San Augustin del Guadalix.

title: (28030) Madrid - 66 Calle Jose Bergamín
description: It is a park that you can see that the works have been finished very recently and they are just putting up trees, we have spent 2 very quiet nights. some motorhomes staying overnight but the stalls are small so the motorhomes I have seen parked were occupying 3 stalls. It is a dirt car park with very little unevenness. good for fall - winter - spring, no big trees yet and no cover from the sun. being from land there is a lot of dust and having the windows open is a disaster

title: (28032) Madrid - Blvr. de Jose Prat
description: We discovered this place through a blog. It is free and you can stay overnight. Apparently there are always motorhomes parked here. We spent one night and everything was fine. Safe. It has a shopping center in front and the neighborhood is quiet with large parks.

title: (28033) Madrid - 4 Calle de Julia Balenchana
description: It is a quiet cul-de-sac so you can spend the night without hearing a lot of noise. There are no houses on the street, just some kind of convent and the street is practically dead. down the street and to the right there is a fountain. down the street and across there is a park. more or less nearby there are some shops

title: (28521) Rivas-Vaciamadrid - Autovía del Este, 581
description: Small parking lot, easy access from the highway but almost no noise. Feels like you’re in nature but still very close to the city. Walking routes right by, so great if you have a dog. Didn’t stay overnight but didn’t see any signs prohibiting it.

title: (28033) Madrid - 22 Calle Pedro Salinas
description: Quiet area where you can leave the motorhome and spend the night, has no services, but there are shops, supermarkets, parks, bus stops, restaurants.  Nearby (you can walk to all of them).

title: (28017) Madrid - Avenida de las Trece Rosas
title_short: (28017) Madrid - Avenida de las Trece Rosas
description: Large car park of the Almudena cemetery, no services, to visit Madrid.

title: (19188) Uceda - 11D Avenida Ginebra
description: Parking with lake views. Good for a night. Residential zone. There’s a cafeteria near by. Also many places to swim, river, etc.

title: (28032) Madrid - Autovía del Este
description: Cepsa gas station.

title: (28051) Madrid - 38C Poligono UZP0103 Ensanche Vallecas
description: Good place to spend a night. Quiet and without noise. There is a cafeteria next door for breakfast, 100% recommended.

title: (28034) Madrid - 10 Calle Condestables
description:
A free and fairly quiet car park both during the day and at night.

A 10 minute walk from a metro stop. And by bike 10 minutes from the Castellana.

Highly recommended for old or unlabeled campers, since they cannot enter the m30 and interior of Madrid, due to the environment.

There are no parking lots so close and free around the city.

The only drawback is that it has quite a few holes in the ground, be careful with the bass, although going slow is no problem.

title: () Soto de Viñuelas -
description: In the middle of nature, away from everything, few people come and you are surrounded by trees, near the Isabel channel. Ideal if you like nature.

title: (28028) Madrid - 3 Calle de Roberto Domingo
description: Blue zone parking, from 9:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m., Saturdays and Sundays free. In August until 15:00 the blue zone. Next to the Las Ventas bullring. Many parking lots and easy entrance, although there is an uneven area.

title: (28031) Madrid - 62G Calle del Barranco del Novillo
title_short: (28031) Madrid - 62G Calle del Barranco del Novillo
description: It is a street of a park, near the subway, the squares are large and wide. Ideal for sleeping in squares that are located between two tall buildings of ORTIZ. Near the LA GAVIA subway station and the shopping center of the same name that is reached on foot.

title: (28028) Madrid - 79 Avenida Toreros
description: Next to the Plaza de Toros de Las Ventas. Urban transport and the city nearby. Parking closed on bullfighting days.

title: (28051) Madrid - 109 Calle del Rayo Vallecano de Madrid
title_short: (28051) Madrid - 109 Calle del Rayo Vallecano de Madrid
description: Ample parking to spend the night, very quiet area in the Vallecas neighborhood, it does not have any service except for some bins.

address.street: 109 Calle del Rayo Vallecano de Madrid
